result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Rodriguez

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Melissa Marie Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

DTC - PHASE 1

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 1 point.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Participant is awarded the NEXT STEP AWARD. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Melissa Marie Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court to address concerns. The Court addressed the defendants' compliance with the program. Court IMPOSES AND STAYS a 3 day jail sanction. Court orders the defendant to immediately go to First Step for detox.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Melissa Marie Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE 1

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 1 point.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel informed the court that defendant is completing application for drug treatment court and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court in person with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen who appears by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Sylvan Jaspen; filed.

Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Melissa Marie Rodriguez in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melissa Marie Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
